definitions.definition: a group of senior members of a government that is responsible for advising and deciding on government policy

examples.text: the shadow Cabinet *(= the most important members of the opposition party)*
The cabinet is/are meeting today to discuss the situation.
The defeat in the vote forced the Cabinet to change its policy on immigration.
The issue was discussed at yesterday's cabinet meeting.
The inner Cabinet is to meet again today.
The prime minister reshuffled his Cabinet yesterday.
The affair led to a mid-term Cabinet reshuffle.
She lost her position as Health Minister in a recent cabinet reshuffle.
He is a member of the Shadow Cabinet.
Several cabinet ministers have been implicated in the scandal.

definitions.definition: a piece of furniture with doors, drawers and/or shelves, that is used for storing or showing things

examples.text: The china was displayed in a glass cabinet.

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent.: from cabin + -et, influenced by French cabinet.
